Thousands of international students come to Canada yearly to study at its colleges and universities. Many of these students are eligible for a post-graduate work permit once they complete their studies. PGWP Canada aims to retain students by allowing them to work for any Canadian employer in any industry. Once the study program is complete (and the written notification of eligibility for a degree, diploma, or certificate is proven), the student has 180 days to apply for a post-graduate work permit.

This guide will describe a Canada Post Graduate Work Permit, who is eligible for one, and how to apply for it.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/3″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

What is Post Graduate Work Permit (PGWP)?

A Post Graduate Work Permit (PGWP) is a temporary work permit that allows international graduates to work in Canada. The PGWP is typically valid for anywhere from 8 to 36 months. It is issued after the individual has completed a qualifying educational program at a Canadian college or university.

Eligibility Requirements: PGWP Canada

Individuals can apply for a PGWP Canada if they meet the following requirements:[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

PGWP from Inside Canada

  •  The applicant is applying within 180 days of completing their education program.
  • The applicant has earned a degree, certificate, or diploma from a designated learning institution after completing a program that is a minimum of 8 months in length.
  • The applicant has maintained their full-time student status throughout their studies in Canada.
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

PGWP from Outside Canada

  • The applicant has been approved for a study permit.
  • The applicant has earned a degree, certificate, or diploma from a designated learning institution after completing a program that is a minimum of eight months in length.
  • The applicant has maintained their full-time student status throughout their studies.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” Get a Full-time Working Opportunity in Canada

Apply for the Post Graduate Work Permit PGWP Canada with licensed experts.[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Book a consultation” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#ffffff” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/3″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_highlighted_text color_type=”regular” highlight_color=”#ffc3b7″ style=”half_text”]

Who cannot apply for a PGWP?

[/nectar_highlighted_text][vc_column_text]Individuals cannot apply for a post-graduate work permit if:

  • It has been more than 180 calendar days since their study permit expired.
  • They were already issued a PGWP in the past.
  • Have studied French or English as a second language.
  • Studied in self-improvement or general interest programs
  • Completed their studies at a non-Canadian education institution in Canada
[/vc_column_text][nectar_highlighted_text color_type=”regular” highlight_color=”#ffc3b7″ style=”half_text”]

Post Graduate Work Permit Processing Time

Processing a PGWP can take between 80 and 180 days. If you applied before your student permit expired, you could work in Canada while you wait for your PGWP. After finishing all your study course requirements in Canada, you have 180 days to apply for your PGWP.

You can now apply for a PGWP abroad if you leave Canada after finishing your education. Applications for post-graduation work permits previously had to be made only from within Canada. Depending on the visa office processing the PGWP application, additional evidence can be needed if filed outside Canada.[/nectar_highlighted_text][/vc_column][vc_column Start Working in Canada as a Graduate Student

Obtain the Post-Graduate Work Permit after Completing Your Studies.[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Get in touch with us” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/contact-us/”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#ffffff” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/3″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Post Graduate Work Permit Checklist

You must provide the documents mentioned in this Post Graduate Work Permit Checklist to apply for the PGWP Canada:

  • Form IMM 5710 (Extend my stay or Remain in Canada as a Worker)
  • Form IMM 5476 (Use of a Representative )
  • Form IMM 5475 (Authority to Release Personal Information to a Designated Individual)
  • Photocopies of passport pages
  • Photocopies of Identity Document
  • Photocopy of current immigration document (if any)
  • A Final Transcript of Completed Program
  • A Letter from the institution and/or the formal notice of graduation
  • Proof of payment
  • The original letter provided by the institution stating that your intended employment is an essential part of your program of study (for Co-op Workers)
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” Start Your PGWP Application

Get your Post Graduate Work Permit in Canada with the guidance of our licensed experts.[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Book a consultation” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#f7f7f7″ scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Post Graduate Work Permit Application Process (Step-By-Step)

The Post Graduate Work Permit Application Process is summarized below:[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

1. Fill out a Post-Graduate Work Permit Application

Graduates must first fill out their Post-Graduate Work Permit application online. While applying for the PGWP, minor mistakes can lead to application rejection. To avoid any issues in your process, get in touch with our expert RCICs.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

2. Pay the Application Fee

While applying for PGWP online, the applicants are asked to pay a CAD 255 fee. If your study permit expires before you apply, you may have to pay CAD 350 extra to restore your status as a student.

Note: If you fail to apply for PGWP within 90 days after your study permit expires, you will have to leave Canada.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

2. Pay the Application Fee

While applying for PGWP online, the applicants are asked to pay a CAD 255 fee. If your study permit expires before you apply, you may have to pay CAD 350 extra to restore your status as a student.

Note: If you fail to apply for PGWP within 90 days after your study permit expires, you will have to leave Canada.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

3. Gather the Required Documents

Next, graduates must gather the documents required with their application. This includes proof that they have completed their studies. This proof can be provided using one of the documents listed below:

  • Degree or diploma
  • Official letter from the educational institution
  • Official transcripts or copies of transcripts taken from the education institution’s website
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

4. Submit the Application

Graduates must then submit their applications online. Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) may ask the applicant to submit additional documents following this step.

Successful applicants inside Canada will be issued their Post-Graduate Work Permit. Successful applicants outside Canada will be issued their PGWP and a new visitor visa that allows them to enter the country.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#ffffff” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

How COLOSSUS can help you?

Prospective international students interested in acquiring a work permit after studying in Canada should contact us. Our exceptional team of Regulated Immigration Consultants understands the requirements and application process for PGWP visa Canada and can guide you through this process.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#f7f7f7″ scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

FAQs: Post Graduate Work Permit (PGWP Canada)

These are some frequently asked questions about the post-graduate work permit for international students.[/vc_column_text][toggles style=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”Is it necessary to have a job offer to apply for a Post-Graduate Work Permit?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1651744609906{padding-top: 30px !important;padding-right: 30px !important;padding-bottom: 30px !important;padding-left: 30px !important;}”]Yes. Many international students use the Post-Graduate Work Permit to gain work experience in Canada after graduating. They then use this work experience to apply for permanent residence under the Canadian Experience Class program.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Can I get a post-graduate work permit after studying in Canada for one year?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1651744644957{padding-top: 30px !important;padding-right: 30px !important;padding-bottom: 30px !important;padding-left: 30px !important;}”]You may be eligible for a work permit after 1-year study in Canada if the program is from a designated learning institution.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#2d0fb1” scene_position=”center” constrain_group_1=”yes” top_padding_tablet=”2%” constrain_group_3=”yes” bottom_padding_tablet=”2%” top_padding_phone=”2%” constrain_group_5=”yes” bottom_padding_phone=”2%” text_color=”light” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” class=”h2this” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”both” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=”tilt_alt”][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” top_margin=”5%” bottom_margin=”5%” left_margin_phone=”3%” right_margin_phone=”3%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” el_class=”testimonial” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Start your Post Graduate Work Permit Application

Done with your studies in Canada? Apply for PGWP Post-Graduate Work Permit with COLOSSUS.
